greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows of n^2 terms, where row n equals the coefficients in the series reversion of the function G(y,n)-1 such that: y = Sum_{m>=1} 1/G(y,n)^(2*n*m) * Product_{k=1..m} (1 - 1/G(y,n)^(2*k-1)).
link: Paul D. Hanna, Rows n = 1..12, flattened.
formula: G.f. for row n is R(y,n) = Sum_{k=1..n^2} y^k*T(n,k) defined by:
A(x,y) = Sum_{n>=1} x^n * R(y,n) such that:
R(y,n) = Series_Reversion( G(y,n) - 1 ) where G(y,n) satisfies:
example: Consider the family of power series G(x,n) that satisfy:
Examples of sequences with g.f. G(x,n) are:
Observe that Series_Reversion(G(x,n) - 1) is given by the polynomials:
This triangle of coefficients in the above polynomials begins:
program: (PARI) {T(n, k)=local(Axy=x*y); Axy=sum(m=1, n, -x^m*prod(j=1, m, (1-(1+y)^(2*j-1))/(1-x*(1+y)^(2*j-1))+x*O(x^n))); polcoeff(polcoeff(Axy, n, x), k, y)}
(PARI) {a(n, p)=local(A=[1, 1]); for(i=1, n, A=concat(A, 0); A[#A]=-polcoeff(sum(m=1, #A, 1/Ser(A)^(2*p*m)*prod(k=1, m, 1-1/Ser(A)^(2*k-1))), #A-1)); A[n+1]}
{for(n=1, 8, Tn=Vec(serreverse(sum(m=1, n^2, a(m, n)*x^m)+x*O(x^(n^2)))); for(k=1, n^2, print1(Tn[k], ", ")); print(""))}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 25 2012
